availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard Moore Bishop (Cincinnati, Ohio, merchant, politician, and university curator)

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, merchant, politician, and university curator. Fleming County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Threlkeld Bishop. Father of William Bishop, Ellen Bishop, Mary Amanda Bishop, Jacob C. Bishop, Richard H. Bishop, James F. Bishop, Anna Bishop, and Carrie Bishop. Clerk in store from 1830. Partnership in pork shipping business with his brother from 1838. Established a wholesale grocery business known as Bishop, Wells and Company in 1848. Merchant in Cincinnati in 1850. Elected to the Cincinnati city council in 1857. Mayor of Cincinnati from 1859 to 1861. Employed Johanna Mockler, Johanna Mahar, Mary Shaha, and Joseph Sturm as domestic servants in 1860. Returned to wholesale grocery business in 1861. Member of the board of curators of Kentucky University in 1865.

ab.bibl:
